translations.name: The Breton Bible
translations.description: The Breton Bible was translated from the Greek and Hebrew into Breton language by Jean-François Le Gonidec in 1827. After the Catholic Church refused its publication it was eventually published by the British and Foreign Bible Society who had been lobbied to support Le Gonidec by the champion of Welsh language publications, Thomas Price (known as \\\"Carnhuanawc\\\"). The resulting \\\"Protestant\\\" translation was placed on the Index of Banned Books by the Catholic Church.
